line: Begin the abstract two lines below author names and addresses. The abstract summarizes key findings in the paper. It is

line: a paragraph of 200 words or less. For the keywords, select up to 8 key terms for a search on your manuscript's subject.

label: paragraph

line: numbers. It should be in a one-column format. References are often noted in the text1 and cited at the end of the paper.

line: 10 pt. bold, left justify, subsection numbers
label: paragraph

line: Center the paper title at the top of the page in 16-pt. bold. Only the first word, proper nouns, and acronyms are
label: paragraph

line: capitalized. Keep titles brief and descriptive. Spell out acronyms unless they are widely known. Avoid starting with
label: paragraph

line: articles or prepositions, e.g., “The study of … ,” or, “On the ….”
label: paragraph

line: The author list is in 12-pt. regular, centered. Omit titles and degrees such as Dr., Prof., Ph.D., etc. The list of affiliations
label: paragraph

line: follows. Each author's affiliation should be clearly noted.
label: paragraph

line: Section headings are 11-pt. bold capitals, centered. Sections numbers have whole numbers, e.g., 1, 2, 3… Don't number
label: paragraph

line: "References." Headings often used are: 1. Introduction, 2. Methodology, 3. Data,
label: paragraph

line: Subsection headings are left-justified, 10-pt. bold. Capitalize the first word, acronyms, and proper nouns.
label: paragraph

line: Add a blank line above and below section headings and between paragraphs. Avoid headings or one-line paragraphs at
label: paragraph

line: the top or bottom of a page by using page breaks or extra blank lines. One method to preserve page breaks is to make the
label: paragraph

line: bottom margin a little larger than the specifications. Indentation is optional. This spacing is automatic if you are using
label: paragraph

line: Text is 10 point and justified. Each sentence ends with a period and a single space before the next sentence.
label: paragraph

line: Figures are centered. Use or insert .jpg, .tiff, or .gif illustrations instead of PowerPoint or graphic constructions.
label: paragraph

line: Captions go below figures. Indent 5 spaces from left margin and justify.
label: paragraph

line: Figure 1. Figure captions are indented 5 spaces and justified. If you are familiar with Word styles, you can insert a
label: paragraph

line: field code called Seq figure which automatically numbers your figures.
label: paragraph

line: Tables are centered. The caption goes above the table. The caption text should indent 5 spaces from left margin and
label: paragraph

line: justify. Table examples are on page 1 and 2 and below.
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: hyperlink in the digital version of the manuscript.
